instructions:
Thaw the lumpia wrappers in the refrigerator. Brown the ground beef in a 6 qt pot on medium/high and
drain fat. Add the garlic, salt and soy sauce. Add the carrots and cook over low heat for about 4 minutes.
Then add the celery and cook for 2 minutes, and then add the onion and cook for an additional 3 minutes.
Carefully separate the wrappers. Place a heaping soupspoon of dry filling about 3 inches from the edge of
the wrapper and form a 4 inch log of filling. Fold and tightly wrap the near edge, then fold in each end while
continuing to wrap to about an inch from the end of the wrapper. Moisten the last inch with the beaten egg
and seal.
Heat about 1/8 inch oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium to med/high heat, and fry the lumpia rolls
to a golden brown. Drain on paper towels and keep warm in oven. Makes about 24 rolls. Serve with the
dipping sauce below.

1/4 cup soy sauce
1 1/4 tsp lemon juice
1 tsp lime juice
ingredients: 2 medium carrots, machine chopped very fine
1 Spanish onion (3 inch), machine chopped fine
name: Lumpia
creator: Elizabeth Decker
